utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Have you guys heard about this research team that’s trying to transgenically manipulate chicken DNA to create some sort of chicken dinosaur?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, I think that sounds wonderful.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: What? You’re afraid of both dinosaurs and chickens.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes, but tell me a dinosaur chicken salad sandwich wouldn’t hit the Mesozoic spot.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Hey, guys.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hello.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: We still on for tomorrow night?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah. I’m excited to finally meet your girlfriend.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Speaking of which, according to a recent study out of Oxford University, when someone takes on a new romantic partner, that person loses one or two close friends.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Since when do you read social science?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I go to the bathroom like everybody else.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Why would I lose friends just because I started dating someone?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah, you didn’t lose anyone when you met Amy. Yeah, well, no, this study refers to romantic partners. Not the way I would categorize the two of us.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: You guys kiss and hold hands.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’ve seen him do it. It’s not romantic.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Look, I’m not the kind of guy who drops his friends just because he’s in a relationship.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What happens if she doesn’t like us?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Well, hey, you’re my dear friends. You’ll get a Christmas card for a couple of years, and then you’re dead to me.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: So, Howard, is Stuart still living with your mom?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I don’t want to talk about it.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: But he’s going to.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: My mom got him cable. In my whole life, growing up in that house, no cable. Do you know how many HBOs that leech had my mother get him? Seven. Seven HBOs. Seven.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Long story short, they have seven HBOs.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Hey, guys.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hello.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Emily, you know almost everybody here.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: And this is Leonard, this is Penny.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: Oh, it’s so nice to meet you.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Nice to finally meet you, too.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: Hello.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Wow, Raj, you were not lying about her.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I told you she exists.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hey, I hear you’re a dermatologist.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: Uh, yeah, I’m a resident at Huntington Hospital.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, I like their emergency room. Yeah, even if it turns out you don’t have Dengue fever, they still let you take a lollipop.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: You know, Penny just started training to be a pharmaceutical sales rep. Maybe she can practice on you some time.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, it would be great to practice on a real doctor.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: Yeah. I’m sure that’d be fine.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I have some odd freckles on my buttocks. Can I make an appointment for you to look at them?

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: Um, okay, I guess.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I’m with him three years, nothing. She’s with him two minutes, and he’s taking his pants off.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Last night was fun. What did you think of Emily?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I don’t know. I kind of got the sense she didn’t like me.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Did she say she didn’t like you?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Of course not. No one ever says they don’t like you straight to your face.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: We have led different lives.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: You guys just met. Why would she feel that way?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: It’s just this vibe I got.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I’m sure you’re worried about nothing.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah. You’re probably right. I used to think my high school P.E. teacher didn’t like me, but it turned out, she liked me a little too much.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah. It was fine. We went to a Melissa Etheridge concert, I got an A, it all worked out.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: When you go to Emily’s office to practice, you’ll see. It’s fine.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, I hope you’re right.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: You really went your entire life without anyone saying I hate you to your face?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I’d say it now, but look at those cheekbones.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I miss Stuart’s place. All this loud music and exposed brick. What, is this a comic book store, or a rave at the third little pig’s house?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yep, I wish Stuart would reopen. I hate this place, too.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Okay, him I believe because he’s an 80-year-old man in a 15-year-old’s tee shirt. But you’re just upset about Stuart and your mom and all their HBOs.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yes, I am. You know, I can’t even watch Game of Thrones now without thinking of mother saying, Stuart, which one is Thrones?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: You know, he might not reopen. He didn’t get a lot of money from the insurance company.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, boy, if there is one thing that gets my goat, it’s those dad-gum insurance companies.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Why? Because they won’t get off your lawn? Is Stuart trying to get a loan, or, or find investors?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: All I know is, he’s got my mother buying four-ply toilet paper. I mean, four-ply. If his butt is so delicate, why doesn’t he just use an angora rabbit?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: For starters, they shed and bite.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hey, here’s a thought. Why don’t we put up the rest of the money that Stuart needs?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: So, we’d be, like, owners of a comic book store?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: It’s kind of a dream come true.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: That does sound fun.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Ooh, maybe we could come up with a business plan to compete with this place.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’ll give you a plan right now. Step one, open comic book store. Step two, start rumour this comic book store gives you genital warts. Step three, buy a big bag to put the money in.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: It’s not that bad.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Thank you so much for letting me practice my sales pitch on you. I really appreciate it.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: Sure.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Um, I brought coffee. I wasn’t sure what you like, so I got a regular, a cappuccino and a Chai tea. Since you like Raj, I thought you might be into that.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: Thanks. If we could get started. I’m a little busy.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, yeah, sure. Let me just get out my materials. Leonard gave me this briefcase. He used to carry it around in high school. You can still see the dent where they whacked him with it. Okay, I would like to talk to you about our new birth control pill, Femevra.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: Great.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: So, Femevra’s triphasic design provides balanced hormonal exposure.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: All right.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: It has also been shown to cause significantly fewer side effects than other oral contraceptives. Although it can cause acne, which, if you ask me, kind of increases its effectiveness as a contraceptive.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: Funny.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, I’m sorry. Did we get off on the wrong foot? Because since the other night, I kind of feel like you might have a problem with me.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: No, it’s fine.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Are you sure, because it doesn’t seem fine?

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: Okay. If you really want to talk about this, I do have a problem.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, my God. Tell me, what did I do?

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: Look, it’s nothing. It’s just, Raj told me that a while ago, you two hooked up.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What? Oh, why would he say that?

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: Did it not happen?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, I wouldn’t exactly call it a hook-up.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: Did you kiss?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: Were you naked?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: So, it was a hook-up.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No. Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: So, what are some ways we could set our comic book store apart from the competition?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, kids buy comic books. It would be great to figure out a way to get more kids in the store.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You know, when I was a kid, I loved going there, but I could never get a ride.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Ooh, what if we got a van and drove around and picked kids up?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Nice. You mean, like at parks and schools?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Toy stores, puppet shows.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hold on. So, your idea is to get a van and cruise the streets looking for kids to pick up?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: And are you gonna use candy to lure them in?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: We are now.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You told Emily we hooked up?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Um, well, in my defence, I tell everybody.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Why would you say that?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: We were having a conversation about past lovers.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: We weren’t lovers. Come on. Everyone knows we didn’t sleep together. We got drunk and fooled around. Why couldn’t you just leave me out of it?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Well, we were being honest. You would leave me out of the conversation with the next guy if you dumped Leonard?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Why say it?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Well, I would never leave you off my list, and not just because, without you, we’re playing fast and loose with the word list.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, good job. Now she hates me. Ugh.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Great.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: On the bright side, that Oxford study was right. One friend down. I wonder who you’re going to lose next.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: You, okay? It’s you. You’re, you’re next.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No. You’re crazy about me.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I don’t know what Emily’s so upset about anyway. Even if I had slept with him, so what? Everyone has a past.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Hmm-hmm.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Almost everyone has a past.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Come on, look how pretty you are. I’m sure this isn’t the first girl to hate you.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: It’s not.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: And I’m sure you can turn it around.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: How? You can’t force someone to like you.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: What if you just hang around and act like her friend until you wear her down? I mean, next thing you know, you’re in her home, you’re eating her food, drinking her wine.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No, that won’t work.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: You’re right. Cheers.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Oh, I know. Why don’t you use your sales training to go back down there and sell yourself?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Yeah. But instead of selling a drug, you’d be selling Penny. it’s cute.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: It’s stupid.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Well, maybe people would like you more if you didn’t crap all over their ideas.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I’m gonna go with Penny on this one. Then again, why wouldn’t I? I mean, we go way back.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, my God. I didn’t used to like you.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Shh. Amy’s here now.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You know, the more I think about it, the more intrigued I am about having our own store.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: We’ll get to see all the new stuff before it hits the shelves.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: And we’ll get to have fun interactions with our customers. Like, this isn’t a library, buy it or get out.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You say things like that all the time.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes, but as a store owner, I’ll finally have a good comeback to, You don’t work here, shut up.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Uh, do you know how Penny told Raj he should have left her off his list?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, do you think when she and I had that conversation, she left people off her list?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m sure she did.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Because if she hadn’t, she’d still be wading through the list.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Will you stay out of this?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: If only Penny had said that once in a while.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Hey, what difference does it make? You’re the one she wants to marry.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: That’s true.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Yeah, and I’m not sure that complete honesty is always the best thing for a relationship.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yeah, he’s right. Once, in a moment of candour, I told Amy that her hair reminded me of a duck caught in an oil spill. She stormed out. Which was sad, because we were playing Scrabble, and I had all the letters to spell persimmon.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Why are you even part of this conversation? You don’t know anything about women.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I know that if I had a wife or a fiancée, I’d ask her first before I invested money in a comic book store.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: He’s right.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yeah, well, of course I am. I was also right about her hair. It did everything but quack.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: There’s something I wanted to run past you.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What’s up?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Mm, the guys and I were thinking about investing in Stuart’s comic book store. Is that okay?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Why are you asking me?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Well, you know, we’re engaged, and it’s kind of a big deal financially. It seems like something we should talk about.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh. Well, would you consider mounds of credit card debt kind of a big deal financially?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Huh.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Mm. So, me and the guys were talking about this great investment opportunity.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Nope.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: But you didn’t hear what it was.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I know.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Oh, come on.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Fine. What is it?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: It’s to help reopen the comic book store.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Nope.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Well, hear me out.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Howard, you know we’re saving up for a house.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I know, but all the guys are doing it. We’re splitting it four ways, so it’s really not that much money.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: It just seems like a risky investment.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I get that. I, okay, look, the real reason this is important is, before my dad left me and my mom, he used to take me to the comic book store. It was one of the few things we did together.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Oh. Howie, I had no idea.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Well, I don’t like to talk about it.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Oh, baby. That story’s made up, isn’t it?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: That’s how much buying a comic book store means to me.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’d like your honest opinion on something.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Of course.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Now, before I start, I need you to know that I’m very excited about this, and anything you say that isn’t enthusiastically supportive will throw our entire relationship into question. So, keep an open mind.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I’m feeling a little backed into a corner, Sheldon.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Perfect. Now, I’m considering investing in Stuart’s comic book store.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Interesting. Can you see how a grown man, an accomplished scientist, who invests in a store that sells picture books about flying men in colourful underwear might be wasting both his financial and intellectual resources?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Then I think it’s a terrific idea.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Great. Wait till you hear about our van.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Thanks for inviting us over.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, thank you for coming.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: Uh, listen, Penny, before you start, I just want to apologise for being so rude the other day in my office.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: No, no. No need to apologise.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Excuse me, can I say something? I just love both you guys, and I want you to get along. And when I say love I meant as a friend. And, uh, way too soon, right?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, sit down. Listen, Emily, what happened between me and Raj was a long time ago.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: It was, and I may have made it seem like a bigger deal than I should have.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, and Leonard and I are engaged now, and I’m just hoping we can put this whole thing behind us.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: Mm. I’d like that, too. Yeah, I thought I’d be okay with it, but then I saw how pretty you are.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, that’s so sweet. I mean, look at you, you are gorgeous.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: It’s true, you’re both gorgeous. Kind of says something about the man who could bed you both. You get why I’ve been alone most of my adult life.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: So, what brings you by?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Well, I don’t need a reason, it’s my house.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Technically, it’s your mom’s house, but we certainly want you to feel welcome.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I’m always welcome.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Mm, just try and call first.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Okay, let’s get down to business. Howie was thinking about putting up some money to help you reopen the store, but before that happens, I have a few questions.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Oh. I appreciate the offer, but actually your mother already gave me the money.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Yeah. I told her it was too much, but she said she was happy to help out her bubala.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Excuse me. Ma, you are cancelling that cheque, and Stuart is not your bubala, I’m your bubala. You can’t have more than one bubala.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: I don’t know who he’s talking to. She’s at Target, buying me shirts.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I’m so glad we could work this all out.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, me, too.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: You know, we should have dinner one night with you and Leonard.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, we would love that.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Great.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, good night, guys.

utterance.speaker: Emily
utterance.content: All right, night.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Bye.

utterance.speaker: Emily and Penny (simultaneously)
utterance.content: I hate her.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I’m really disappointed we’re not gonna have our own comic book store.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I know. I was looking forward to it.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: It would’ve been so nice to have a place that was ours, where we could just sit and read comics in peace.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: With comfy seats.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: And snacks.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, I guess it was too good to be true.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah.
